channel.title: Random on keerthanapg
channel.description: Recent content in Random on keerthanapg

item.title: Recipe: Horse gram, Kale and Sprouts salad with Rice
item.description: Served with a side of boiled rice. Horse Gram Stir Fried: Originally posted here Ingredients: Horse gram — 1 cup Salt — 1 tbsp Water — 2 cups Green chillies — 4 Red chilli powder — 0.5 tbsp Olive oil — 2 Tbsp Garlic — 3 cloves Curry leaves — optional Preparation: Boil the horse gram with water and salt in a closed container / pressure cooker until cooked.

item.title: Lazy Sunday Morning
item.description: Lazy Sunday Morning Originally posted here June 22, 2013 “It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune must be in want of a wife.” They have been special to me, and yet again, I stumbled upon these lines, as I sat up overnight to finish off David Baldacci’s thriller First Family. To talk of the book, a good plot, but the literature was just, mediocre.

item.title: Recipe: Hefezopf
item.description: Recipe: Hefezopf Originally posted here (This is a creative variant of a German Easter speciality known as Hefezopf) Ingredients: Flour — 400 gms Yeast — 2 tbps Sugar — 1/2 cups Butter — 2 Tbps Water Baking soda — 1/2 tsp Jam — ~10 tsps Walnuts — 1/3 cups Chocolate — 1/3 cups Raisins — 1/3 cups Mix the flour, yeast, sugar, butter, baking soda and water to create a smooth dough and let it rest for an hour.

item.title: Recipe: Palpayasam
item.description: Recipe: Palpayasam Originally posted here This is a traditional Malayali desert. Expected time: 30 minutes Ingredients: Milk: 750mL Water Sugar: 2 Tbsp Rice: 2.5 Tbsp Ghee: 0.75 Tbsp Cashew: 50 grams Cardamom: 1 tsp Procedure: Melt the ghee and saute the rice and cashew in it for 1.5 minutes on high flame. Pour the milk, add sugar and cardamom and cook on low flame until rice is well cooked.

item.title: What to know before donating your hair?
item.description: What to know before donating your hair? Originally posted here This summer, I donated ten inches of my hair to Pantene Beautiful Lengths that make wigs for people suffering from cancer. In the US alone, every year about 100,000 people take chemotherapy for cancer treatment and undergo hair loss. The process of donating is fairly simple and easy though it’s important to keep a thing or two in mind. Before - After What to note:

item.title: Recipe: Ginger-Cardamom Latte Tea
item.description: Recipe: Ginger-Cardamom Latte Tea Originally posted here It’s healthy, tasty and complements well when you’re working on tough assignments :P Ingredients(makes 2 cups): Water — 1 cup Milk — 1 cup Sugar — based on preference Tea leaves — 2 tsps( I use Red Label brand and the strength of the tea depends on the brand somewhat. Green tea is weak) Ginger — small chunk (approx 2cm _ 2cm _ 0.

item.title: Recipe: BlueBerry Pancakes
item.description: Recipe: Blueberry Pancakes Originally posted here Preparation time: 10 minutes Ingredients: Blueberries(fresh/dried):150g Pancake mix: 2/3 cup Water: 1/2 cup Sugar/sugar syrup: 1.5tsp/1.5 tbsp Butter: 1 tsp (optional) Cream cheese: 0.5 tsp (optional) Procedure: Mash the blueberries such that there still are small lumps. Add the flour, water and sugar and mix thoroughly to remove flour lumps. Regulate water to alter consistency. Stop when it looks like dosa batter.

item.title: Rains, Thieves and Broken Dreams
item.description: Rains, Thieves and Broken Dreams Originally posted here Sourced from Google Images Unlike most of India that receives rains once, Kerala has two rounds of monsoons. The first of the season arrives in June when the advancing monsoons make bountiful our harvest and rake up our GDP numbers. The brief spell of unperturbed sunlight is broken by the retreating monsoons, popularly called ‘Thulavarsham’ for they occur in the month of October/’Thula’, taking their leave from the country having toured thoroughly.

item.title: Recipe: Easy Baked Chicken
item.description: Recipe: Easy Baked Chicken Originally posted here Preparation time- 35 minutes What you need: Tender chicken breasts — 0.5 pounds Olive oil — 2 table spoons Ginger garlic paste — 1 table spoon Pepper finely ground — 1 teaspoon Chilly powder — 0.25 teaspoon Garam masala — a pinch Turmeric powder— a pinch Lemon — a small slice Salt — as required How to: Mix the powders and ginger-garlic to a paste.

item.title: Recipe: Quick and Easy Pasta
item.description: Originally posted here Sharing successful tidbits from my reluctant adventures as a student cook. :) Ingredients: Pasta — 1 cup Salsa sauce — 3 table spoons Cut up veggies — 3/5 cup Soy sauce — 1 tsp Garlic powder/paste — 1/2 tsp Ginger powder/paste — 1/4 tsp Chilli powder — 3/4 tsp Parmesan Cheese grated — 1/4 cup Mayonnaise — 1.5 tsp Pepper grated — 1 tsp Butter/ghee — 1 tsp Vegetable oil — 1 tsp Tomato sauce — 1 table spoon Salt — 1 tsp Turmeric powder — a pinch Steps:

item.title: An Eventful Dream
item.description: An eventful dream Originally posted here This is an account of a dream I had today: It was set in the years of the freedom movement in India and World War 2. Agricultural production had failed due to drought, war, plunder and loot by the imperialists to aid war supplies. My grandmother and I, two patriots on the run, lived in a small and claustrophobic mud-walled shack with a tiny door and window, in the basement of a busy school building.
